text: {{Infobox writer | name = Joe Hill | image = Joe Hill by Gage Skidmore.jpg | caption = Hill at the 2019 WonderCon | birth_name = Joseph Hillstrom King | birth_date = | birth_place = Bangor, Maine, U.S. | occupation = | nationality = American | alma_mater = Vassar College | period = 1996–present | genre = Horror, dark fantasy, science fiction | subject = | movement = | spouse = | children = 5 | parents = | relatives = Owen King (brother) | influences = | influenced = | website = }} Joseph Hillström King (born June 4, 1972), pen name Joe Hill, is an American writer. He wrote the novels Heart-Shaped Box (2007), Horns (2010), NOS4A2 (2013), and The Fireman (2016). He also wrote the short story collections 20th Century Ghosts (2005) and Strange Weather (2017); and the comic book series Locke & Key (2008–2013).
